I20041102-2000

Attempt to terminate a target failed - the step/terminate actions in the debug 
view then became unuseable. I had to restart the workbench. Found this in 
my .log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2004-11-03 13:48:58.62
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "&Terminate".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.model.RuntimeProcess.terminate
(RuntimeProcess.java:187)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget.terminate
(JDIDebugTarget.java:1260)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIThread.terminate
(JDIThread.java:1482)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIStackFrame.terminate
(JDIStackFrame.java:945)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.TerminateActionDelegate.doAction
(TerminateActionDelegate.java:25)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.actions.AbstractDebugActionDelegate$1.run
(AbstractDebugActionDelegate.java:192)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Fixed in RuntimeProcess. Use getter and local var with null checks, rather 
than accessing instance var directly. We used to use synchronization to avoid 
the NPE, but that created a deadlock situation - see bug 75546.
